tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: User accounts allows people to register for ID4i and login. All permissions and roles for interactive ID4i usage (as opposed to machine-to-machine interactions) are attached to Organizations and User Accounts. The API allows users to register, verify their registration, login and reset their passwords.

tags.name: Auditing
tags.description: Auditing services allow to review changes made by users or api keys. Changelog messages can be resolved as plain text or formatted message with parameters.

tags.name: History
tags.description: Allows to retrieve a GUID's history and to publish new history items.

tags.name: Images
tags.description: Services can use images stored with public visibility. This API allows you to retrieve the stored image by ID.

get.summary: Tells you whether your company needs to have a contract with BlueRain to be able to sign up
get.description: On production systems, users must confirm that their organization has a valid contract for ID4i usage. It is not required on test and sandbox systems.

post.description: Requesting a reset for a new password.

parameters.name: resetRequest
parameters.description: Contains the required information to request a new password.

put.description: Setting a new password and verifying the request to set the password.

parameters.name: verificationRequest
parameters.description: Contains the new password and the verification token to set the new password.

parameters.name: userRegistration
parameters.description: The user information about the new created user.

put.description: Completing a registration e.g. for invited users. Finish registration with a username and a password.

parameters.name: completeRegistration
parameters.description: Contains the verification token, the username and the initial password.

active.description: Whether this API key is active

label.description: The label / name of the api key

organizationId.description: The organization namespace this api key belongs to

id.description: The unique id of the changelog entry

message.example: User {{&user}} has changed the title of {{&object}}
message.description: The message as template or rendered as plain text

messageProperties.description: The values of the properties in the message. May be nested as object with a value field

timestamp.description: The UTC unix timestamp when this change occurred

count.description: The total number of GUIDs to create

length.description: The charactersequence length of the GUID

organizationId.description: The namespace of the organization where the generated GUIDs should be assigned.

createdTimestamp.description: The UTC unix timestamp of when this GUID has been created

physicalState.description: Physical attachment state of the GUID

holderOrganizationId.description: Organization namespace of the holder of the collection

ownerOrganizationId.description: Organization namespace of the collection owner

physicalState.description: Physical attachment state of the collection

sequenceId.description: Forms the primary key of the history item together with the GUID and the organizationId

organizationId.description: New organization id displayed for this item. If given, must match the holder of GUID and the organization the history item is found under.

createdTimestamp.description: The UTC unix timestamp of when this ID has been created

id.description: The id of the organization ( Deprecated: Use namespace instead. )

logoURL.description: URL to a logo of the organization

ownerOrganizationId.description: The organization's namespace which owns the document

holderOrganizationId.description: The current holder of the object

keepOwnership.description: Keep the public ownership while transferring the object

ownerOrganizationId.description: The current publicly visible owner of the object

recipientOrganizationIds.description: Allow only these organizations to obtain this object
